business.headline: EPFO likely to maintain 8.25% interest rate on PF deposits EPFO interest rate: In 2024-25, EPFO processed over 50.8 million claims worth Rs 2.05 lakh crore when compared to 44.5 million claims amounting to Rs 1.82 lakh crore settled in the previous year, as per the official data.

Adani Green Energy exits Sri Lanka wind power deal; stock down 1%As per the agreement with Sri Lanka, Adani Green was to construct two wind power projects in Mannar town and Pooneryn village, both located in the northern province of the country.

Sensex, Nifty erase gains to end lower as IT stocks weigh in on stock marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 32.11 points to close at 76,138.97, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 13.85 points to end at 23,031.40.

Finance Minister Nirmala SItharaman introduces new Income Tax Bill in Lok SabhaFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman tabled the new Income Tax bill in Lok Sabha amid the huge uproar by the opposition MPs. The bill will now be referred to the Select Committee of Lok Sabha for further review.
New Income Tax Bill tabled in Lok Sabha, faces select panel reviewThe government, in a bid to simplify the present Income Tax Act, 1961, has introduced a new income tax bill in Parliament today.

Explained: Why are large-cap mutual funds back in demandWith small-cap and mid-cap stocks experiencing corrections, investors are moving towards large-cap funds, which are considered safer and more stable in volatile times.

Quality Power IPO: 10 things investors must know before subscribing Quality Power Electrical Equipments Limited offers high-voltage electrical equipment and solutions for grid connectivity and energy transition.

New Income Tax Bill: How will it make taxpayers' lives simpler?The new income tax bill would be almost half of the current law, as the existing Income Tax Act,1961 contained 880 pages when it came into existence.
Sensex gains 500 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising todayAs of 10:48 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 47.85 points at 76,644.93, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 137.75 points to 23,183.00.

Sensex, Nifty open higher as cooling inflation boosts market sentimentShare Market Today: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 163.21 points to 76,334.39, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 46.25 points to 23,091.50 as of 9:30 AM.

Ajax Engineering IPO: Check allotment status, listing date and latest GMPAjax Engineering IPO allotment status: The IPO price band was set at Rs 599 to Rs 629 per share. The minimum lot size for the application was 23 shares. For retail investors, the minimum investment required was Rs 13,777.

New Income Tax Bill to be tabled today: Here's what you can expectNew Income Tax Bill is expected to come into effect on April 1, 2026. The bill aims to simplify tax laws, remove outdated provisions, and make compliance easier for taxpayers.

Can a married couple save more taxes using both old and new tax regime?Married couples need to determine which tax regime offers lower tax liability for each spouse considering their income structure and deductions.

India's retail inflation dips to 4.31% in January, hits a five-month lowThe country's retail inflation witnessed a drop in January majorly due to declining food prices, according to data released by the National Statistics Office on Wednesday.

Sensex, Nifty recover sharply but end in red; M&M falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex settled 122.52 points lower at 76,171.08. Earlier in the day, the 30-share index had plunged 850 points. Nifty, too, recovered strongly to end 26.55 points lower at 23,045.25.

Mutual fund inflows see slight dip in January. Here's whyThe flows declined 3.6% month-on-month to 396.88 billion rupees ($4.57 billion) from 411.56 billion rupees in December 2024, according to data by the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI).

New Income Tax Bill to introduce simpler 'tax year' concept: All you need to knowWhen the Income Tax Act of 1961 came into being it had 880 pages. Over the years, the act contained several amendments introduced in the various budgets.

Stock market bloodbath: Should buy the dip, exit or stay invested? The stock market correction has particularly hit retail investors, many of whom are contemplating selling their holdings at a loss. But is that the right move?

After 90-hour workweek remark, L&T chief stirs work-from-home debateThis is not the first time that the L&T Chairman's remarks have sparked a debate.  Earlier, he advocated a 90-hour workweek, which drew huge criticism.

Will retail inflation cool down further in January? Here's all you need to know The RBI mentioned continued reduction in rice prices and sharp corrections in the prices of vegetables, especially in the prices of onions, potatoes and tomatoes, in its January 2025 Bulletin.

entertainment.headline: Twilight star Taylor Lautner to return as werewolf in self-aware werewolf seriesTwilight star Taylor Lautner is returning to portray a werewolf in the self-aware Amazon series. Details of the show are yet to be revealed.

Anupamaa actor Rupali Ganguly seeks blessings at Maha KumbhActor Rupali Ganguly visited Maha Kumbh in Prayagraj with her family. She shared moments from her spiritual visit, including performing aarti, attending a hawan, and meeting a saint.

Nawazuddin Siddiqui begins Raat Akeli Hai 2 shooting in LucknowActor Nawazuddin Siddiqui has begun Raat Akeli Hai 2 shooting in Lucknow. The actor will be seen sharing screen space with Chitragandha Singh.

Olivia Swann on NCIS: Sydney, her character's growth & challenges In this exclusive interview with India Today's Bhavna Agarwal, Olivia Swann dives deep into her role in NCIS: Sydney, sharing insights into her character's journey, development, and challenges throughout the series.

Rozlyn Khan sues Ankita Lokhande for defamation over 'cheap' remark TV actor Rozlyn Khan took legal action against Ankita Lokhande's recent comments. Ankita had called her 'cheap', for her claims about Hina Khan's cancer battle.

Jackson Wang makes a powerful comeback with High Alone from Magic Man 2Jackson Wang drops a new single, High Alone, that marks the beginning of his new album, MAGIC MAN 2. The album promises a deep dive into themes of identity and personal transformation, set against a backdrop of atmospheric production and introspective lyrics.

Actor John Lithgow approached to play Albus Dumbledore in Harry Potter seriesAward-winning American actor John Lithgow has reportedly been approached to play the iconic character of Hogwarts principal Albus Dumbledore in HBO's Harry Potter series.

Rupali Ganguly's stepdaughter calls her 'evil step lady', issues clarificationRupali Ganguly's stepdaughter, Esha Verma, clarified her viral social media post against the actor. Esha requested privacy.

Truth behind viral video of Ranveer Allahbadia crying over 'loss of work'Amid backlash over India's Got Latent, an old video of Ranveer Allahbadia crying resurfaces. In the video, the podcaster is seen breaking down over 'loss of work'.

Jonas Brothers hint at big change for 2025, shocked fans ask, 'another breakup?'The Jonas Brothers shared a letter on social media that briefly sent fans into a panic. In it, they hinted at their 2025 lineup and expressed gratitude to their fans for supporting them throughout their musical journey.

Kapil Sharma's 'Maa Baap ki Kabaddi' joke goes viral amid Ranveer Allahbadia rowAmid the controversy over Ranveer Allahbadia's comment on Samay Raina's show India's Got Latent, an old clip of Kapil Sharma joking about kids watching "maa baap ki kabaddi" is going viral.

Watch: Did AR Rahman refer to Ranveer Allahbadia row at Chhaava music launch?AR Rahman made a humorous remark at the Chhaava music launch that has led to speculation about its connection to the recent controversy involving Ranveer Allahbadia and Samay Raina.

Ed Sheeran's India dump features photo from football match with John AbrahamSinger Ed Sheeran shared his India dump, which also featured a glimpse of his football match with Bollywood actor John Abraham. Sheeran is in India for his Mathematics Tour.

Aly Goni feels Samay Raina was 'forced' to delete India's Got Latent episodesActor Aly Goni has commented on YouTuber-comedian Samay Raina's decision to remove episodes of India's Got Latent. Fans have also reacted to Samay's decision on social media.
Odia rapper Abhinav Singh, 32, dies by suicide in BengaluruA rapper from Odisha, Abhinav Singh, died in Bengaluru where he was working for a private company. He was 32.

Kendrick Lamar's Super Bowl Halftime show is the most-watchedRapper Kendrick Lamar's Super Bowl Halftime show has become the most-watched Super Bowl show of all time, garnering an impressive 133.5 million views.

Too much to handle: Samay Raina deletes all videos from his show amid jokes rowComedian Samay Raina finally broke his silence on the controversy over Ranveer Allahbadia's remark on his show, India's Got Latent. He has confirmed deleting all the videos of the show, and also added that whatever is happening right now is too much for him to handle.

Amy Adams joins Javier Bardem in Cape Fear TV adaptationAfter Javier Bardem, actor Amy Adams is on board for the much-awaited Cape Fear TV adaptation. The release date for the show has not been announced yet.

Kanye West dropped by talent agency amid antisemitic, controversial actionsKanye West's controversial actions have led to his talent agency, 33&West, dropping him. The decision follows a series of antisemitic remarks and troubling social media posts by the rapper that have sparked widespread condemnation.

Samay Raina's show in Gujarat cancelled amid India's Got Latent controversyComedian Samay Raina's Gujarat shows have been cancelled following a controversy sparked by the latest episode of his show, India's Got Latent. The decision comes amid backlash after a distasteful comment by YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia on the show.

general news.headline: President's Rule imposed in Manipur days after Biren Singh's resignationManipur has been placed under President's Rule after the BJP failed to name a successor following the resignation of N Biren Singh as the Chief Minister.

'Today is the big one - reciprocal tariffs': Trump's cryptic post before meet with PMAhead of his meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi around 2.30 am (IST) on February 14, US President Donald Trump sparked speculation with his cryptic 'reciprocal tariffs' post.

PM Modi to meet Elon Musk, talks with Trump to include tariffs, immigrationPM Modi, who landed in Washington DC on Thursday after a fruitful visit to France, has a jam-packed schedule that also includes a meeting with tech titan Elon Musk.

Violence-hit Bangladesh Hindus sought safety at border, BSF sent them away: UNA fact-finding report from the United Nations Human Rights office corroborates reports that Hindus in Bangladesh were targeted in July and August last year. It also describes how India's Border Security Force (BSF) reportedly sent back 4,000 Hindus who had sought shelter near the border fearing for their lives.

What to do when your in-laws pressure you about kids - even in 2025It's 2025, but some people are still stuck with the idea that all married couples, whether they want kids or not, should have them. But with DINK (Dual Income, No Kids) couples at an all-time high, how can you tackle the family pressure with the utmost subtlety?

2nd flight with Indians deported from US to land in Amritsar on Saturday: SourcesA second flight carrying Indians deported from the US is likely to land in Amritsar on February 15. Sources said that another flight carrying illegal Indian immigrants is likely to arrive after that.

Bengaluru Metro fare reduced by up to 30% after backlash over hikeFollowing public backlash, BMRCL has revised the recent metro fare hike, reducing prices by up to 30 per cent. The board reviewed feedback and corrected abnormal fare increases, effective immediately.

Kerala nursing college ragging video surfaces, shows victim tied, being torturedDisturbing footage from the Government Nursing College in Kottayam shows a junior student being tied up, stabbed with a compass, and tortured by seniors. Five third-year students were arrested after the victim and two others filed a police complaint detailing months of ragging.

Kerala's Rs 1,000-crore half-price scam: Victims explain how they got dupedIn one of the biggest scams in Kerala, a 26-year-old graduate duped 40,000 people across the state with a Ponzi-style network, offering scooters, mobiles, laptops and other household items at half their price. This is how Ananthu Krishnan pulled off the state-wide Rs 1,000-crore scam.

Indian courts under pressure from Modi government? DY Chandrachud counters BBCFormer Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud maintained that despite external pressures, the Supreme Court continues to uphold personal liberties and the rule of law, ensuring that judicial independence remains the cornerstone of India's democracy.

What is India-Middle East-Europe Corridor and how will it benefit India?Prime Minister Narendra Modi and French President Emmanuel Macron reviewed the India-Middle East-Europe Corridor project on Wednesday in France and agreed to work on it together.

Looking for a 5-star safety-rated car under Rs 10 lakh? We have you all coveredMany cars under Rs 10,00,000 (ex-showroom) now have safety features like six airbags, electronic stability control, brakeforce assist system, vehicle stability management, hill-start assist control and emergency stop signal, as standard.

Truth behind viral video of Ranveer Allahbadia crying over 'loss of work'Amid backlash over India's Got Latent, an old video of Ranveer Allahbadia crying resurfaces. In the video, the podcaster is seen breaking down over 'loss of work'.

Stop calling me king, I am not there yet, Babar Azam tells fans and mediaStar Pakistan batter Babar Azam has urged his fans and the media to stop calling him king. Babar hasn't had a memorable run in the first two matches of the tri series.

Middle-class shift, BJP's money power: AAP's reasons behind Delhi poll debacleThe AAP managed to win just 22 seats after consecutive near-sweeps in the 2015 and 2020 polls. Top AAP sources told India Today that the party has identified three key reasons behind its defeat.

Harshwardhan Sapkal replaces Nana Patole as Maharashtra Congress chiefCongress chief Mallikarjun Kharge appointed Harshwardhan Sapkal as the President of the Maharashtra Pradesh Congress Committee with immediate effect.

Retired Berkeley professor drives Uber once a week, donates profits. Viral postIn a post on X, Sonith Sunku shared a picture of the Uber driver - Professor Paul – who studied at the Stanford University and earned a PhD in mathematics and economics at the age of 24.

Why BMI isn't the most accurate measure of obesityBody Mass Index cannot differentiate between muscle mass, fat and bone density. Doctors suggest other markers and scans to measure how obese an individual is

Amid Waqf bill storm in Parliament, Amit Shah says no objection to dissent notes Live UpdatesOpposition MPs claimed that portions of dissent notes were removed from the report on the Waqf bill and resorted to sloganeering in Parliament, leading to adjournment of proceedings.

Himanta Sarma jabs Congress's Gaurav Gogoi, wife over 'Pak link', MP hits backHimanta Sarma, in a spree of posts on X, has raised Gaurav Gogoi's meeting with then Pakistani High Commissioner in 2015 despite India's protest and alleged that the Congress MP's wife had ISI links.

Ajith Kumar redefines masculinity in Tamil cinema with strong anti-patriarchy standAjith Kumar, in his recent films, took an anti-patriarchy and anti-misogynistic stand. His latest film, Vidaamuyarchi, is an example.

Virat Kohli's message to new RCB captain Rajat Patidar: You've earned thisVirat Kohli sent a heartfelt message to RCB's new captain Rajat Patidar and claimed that the MP batter earned the right to become the new skipper of the franchise. Patidar was announced as the new RCB captain on February 13.

UN report exposes Yunus on attacks on Hindus in BangladeshA UN report on human rights violations and abuses has debunked Muhammad Yunus' claims of "exaggerated propaganda" by confirming widespread violence against Hindus, their temples and businesses in post-Hasina Bangladesh. The report, conducted on the invitation of Yunus' interim government, details incidents of targeted mob attacks and arson.

Kamal Haasan set for Rajya Sabha, DMK keeps its word, Udhayanidhi Stalin meets himActor Kamal Haasan is set to become a Rajya Sabha MP from the DMK's quota, as the ruling party fulfils its 2024 electoral pact. Udhayanidhi Stalin met Haasan at his residence to congratulate him.

Farhan Akhtar's special birthday wish for daughter Akira: Be your incredible selfFarhan Akhtar shared a sweet birthday message for his daughter Akira on Instagram. He encouraged her to be her incredible self and assured her of his support.

Twilight star Taylor Lautner to return as werewolf in self-aware werewolf seriesTwilight star Taylor Lautner is returning to portray a werewolf in the self-aware Amazon series. Details of the show are yet to be revealed.

Diljit Dosanjh on Panjab 95 release: Will support film if released without any cutsActor-singer Diljit Dosanjh gave an update about his upcoming film, Panjab 95. Dosanjh said that he would be associated with the project if released without any cuts.

Rashmika Mandanna's shout-out for Vijay Deverakonda's Kingdom: So proudActor Rashmika Mandanna recently shared a sweet shout-out for her rumoured partner and actor, Vijay Deverakonda, after the teaser of his film Kingdom hit the internet.

sports.headline: IPL: Did Virat Kohli say no to returning as RCB captain for 2025 season?IPL 2025: After retiring from T20Is last year, Virat Kohli was widely expected to return as RCB captain. However, on February 13, the franchise appointed Rajat Patidar as their skipper for the upcoming season.

Unsold in auction, teenager gets Mumbai Indians call-up after World Cup heroicsWomen's Premier League 2025: Mumbai Indians roped in U19 World Cup star Parunika Sisodia as a replacement for injured Pooja Vastrakar. Defending champions RCB will miss the services of Asha Sobhana as the leg-spinner has been ruled out due to injury.

Bangladesh appoint Mehidy Hasan Miraz as vice captain for Champions TrophyBangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) announced Mehidy Hasan Miraz as their vice-captain for the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Bangladesh will start their campaign against India on February 20.

Families not to travel with Indian players for Champions Trophy to Dubai: Report Champions Trophy 2025: The Indian team is set to leave for Dubai on February 15. However, families won't accompany the players for the three-week-long tournament.

Stop calling me king, I am not there yet, Babar Azam tells fans and mediaStar Pakistan batter Babar Azam has urged his fans and the media to stop calling him king. Babar hasn't had a memorable run in the first two matches of the tri series.

UP Warriorz focused on playing positive brand of cricket: Deepti Sharma WPL 2025: In the Star Sports Press Room - WPL Captain's Huddle, newly-appointed skipper Deepti Sharma said that the UP Warriorz will be looking to play a positive brand of cricket and turn their fortunes around after failing last season when they couldn't go beyond the league stage.
Rawalpindi Cricket StadiumThe Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium is one of the three venues in Pakistan hosting the Champions Trophy 2025. Established in 1992, the stadium has a seating capacity of 15,000.

Gadaffi Stadium, LahoreWith a seating capacity of 34,000-plus, the Gadaffi stadium in Lahore is the biggest stadium in Lahore. The stadium will be hosting 4 matches during the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025, including the semi-final 2.

Can South Africa overcome poor ODI form to strike gold in Champions Trophy?South Africa eye redemption in the Champions Trophy, aiming to shake off their "chokers" tag. With a strong batting lineup, spin concerns, and injury woes, Bavuma's men must step up to reclaim past ICC glory.

IPL 2025: Rajasthan Royals appoint Sairaj Bahutule as spin bowling coachRajasthan Royals appointed former India wrist spinner Sairaj Bahutule as their spin-bowling coach for the upcoming season of the IPL.

Rohit forgets T20 World Cup win? Kohli hilariously explains in new adRohit Sharma hilariously forgets India's T20 World Cup triumph in a new Dream11 ad, featuring Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant, and KL Rahul, as the team sets its sights on Champions Trophy glory.

2 spinners too many: R Ashwin not a fan of India's Champions Trophy squadFormer spinner R Ashwin admitted that he isn't a fan of India's squad for the upcoming Champions Trophy 2025 and feels that India are carrying 2 spinners more than needed. India have 5 spinners in the squad for the tournament.

Pakistan's Shaheen Afridi fined heavily for altercation during ODI tri-seriesShaheen Afridi was fined 25 percent of his match fee for making deliberate physical contact with Matthew Breetzke, while Saud Shakeel and Kamran Ghulam also faced penalties for aggressive celebrations during Pakistan's win over South Africa.

Jasprit Bumrah trains hard at NCA after being ruled out of Champions Trophy Star India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah shared a glimpse of his training at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru after being ruled out of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Rohit Sharma is selfless, he has led India's ODI transformation: R AshwinChampions Trophy: Former India spinner R Ashwin said that India were late to embrace modern-day one-day international cricket, but Rohit Sharma, with his selfless approach, transformed the team's mindset in the 50-over format.

National Stadium KarachiChampions Trophy 2025 Venue: The National Stadium in Karachi, now revamped as the National Bank Cricket Arena, is set to host the ICC Champions Trophy opener, marking a historic return for Pakistan's cricketing fortress after an extensive renovation.

UP Warriorz will miss Alyssa Healy, but I'm not under pressure: Deepti WPL 2025: Skipper Deepti Sharma admitted that the UP Warriorz will miss Alyssa Healy, but also sounded confident of her team making strong comeback after failing to qualify for the final in the first two seasons.

Dubai International Cricket StadiumThe Dubai International Cricket Stadium, also known as the Ring Of Fire, will host all of India's matches during the Champions Trophy 2025 and also the semi-final. If India qualifies for the final, the match will be played in Dubai. The stadium has a capacity of 25,000.

Asia Team Championships: India lose 2-3 to Korea, but assured of quarters placeBadminton Asia Team Championships 2025: Men's singles player Sathish Kumar Karunakaran and the women's doubles pair of Gayatri Gopichand and Jolly Treesa helped India recover from 0-2 down, but they lost to South Korea 2-3 in the final group-stage tie. India booked their berth in the quarter-final.

India booked their berth in the quarter-final.

Not pregnant: Healy clears air on Starc's Champions Trophy withdrawalMitchell Starc's wife and Australia women's team star, Alyssa Healy, has cleared the air regarding the pacer's decision to skip the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Starc had opted out of the tournament for personal reasons.

Kohli does not need captaincy to lead RCB: Bobat explains Patidar callRCB team director Mo Bobat assured that despite Rajat Patidar's captaincy appointment, Virat Kohli will continue to play a vital leadership role, offering invaluable experience and guidance to the team without needing the official title.

Virat Kohli's message to new RCB captain Rajat Patidar: You've earned thisVirat Kohli sent a heartfelt message to RCB's new captain Rajat Patidar and claimed that the MP batter earned the right to become the new skipper of the franchise. Patidar was announced as the new RCB captain on February 13.

IPL 2025: Rajat Patidar named new RCB captain, Virat Kohli backs callRoyal Challengers Bengaluru decided to name Rajat Patidar as their new captain for the IPL 2025 season. Patidar became RCB's 8th captain in their IPL history and replaced Faf du Plessis.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
